member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.Primitives.PercentEditor.FromStringFactor
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that is used to adjust the value when converting the value to a FromString representation

remarks.p: This property defaults to 1 so that the value is used as is when being converted to a string. If the was set to P0, a percent format which means the value is multiplied by 100, so when determining the new Value, the numeric value should be divided by 100 so the FromStringFactor might be set to '.01'. However if the Value was expected to be in the range from 0-100 then one might set the factor to 1.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.Primitives.PercentEditor.SmallChange
member.summary: Returns or sets the number of units by which the will be incremented or decremented when spinning.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.Primitives.PercentEditor.SpinToNearestSmallChange
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the will be anchored to the nearest modulus of the when incremented or decremented via spinning.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.Primitives.PercentEditor.StringFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the format for the DateTime portion of the value.

remarks.p: Note: If you use a format that adjusts the value (e.g. a percent format will multiply the value by 100) then you may need to set the and/or .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Editors.Primitives.PercentEditor.ToStringFactor
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that is used to adjust the value when converting the value to a ToString representation

remarks.p: This property defaults to 1 so that the value is used as is when being converted to a string. If the was set to P0, a percent format which means the value is multiplied by 100, and the values being used were in the range 0-100 then one might set this to 0.01.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.GanttTaskBarRoundingBehavior.WhenProjectTimeZoneMatchesLocal
member.summary: The bars will be rounded to the day (when the smallest timescale interval is 1 day or more) or to the containing timescale interval (when the smallest timescale interval is less than 1 day) as long as the is the same as the . The start is only rounded when the start time matches the and the end is only rounded when the end time matches the .

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.GanttTaskBarRoundingBehavior.Never
member.summary: The bars will always be positioned based on their actual time.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningAction
member.summary: Represents the various actions possible when a warning occurs with one of the task constraints.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningAction.DoNotModifyConstraint
member.summary: Allow the action or conflict without modifying the constraint. Note: this value cannot be used for the ConstraintConflictsWithSubtaskConstraint warning, because the constraint must be modified in this situation. For the ChangeConstraintType warning, DoNotModifyConstraint can be used in some situations but not others. For example, when setting the ConstraintDate to null, the ConstraintType must be changed to AsSoonAsPossible or AsLateAsPossible. However, when setting the Start of a task in a project scheduled from the start date, the ConstraintType will be changed to StartNoEarlierThan and the ConstraintDate will be changed to the new Start value unless the DoNotModifyConstraint action is used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningAction.ModifyConstraint
member.summary: Modify the associated task's constraint by using the and .

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningAction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the change which caused the warning. If other warnings were previously accepted and the current warning is cancelled, they will be cancelled as well.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningType
member.summary: Represents the various types of warnings which can occur with a task's constraint.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningType.ChangeConstraintType
member.summary: Occurs when a change on a task will cause the change automatically.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningType.ConstraintConflictsWithSubtaskConstraint
member.summary: Occurs when is True and a subtask cannot honor both its summary constraint and its own. In this case, the task associated with the event, and the one which will be modified if the ModifyConstraint action is used is the lowest level summary constraint which conflicts with the subtask.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskConstraintWarningType.PossibleFutureConflict
member.summary: Occurs when a future conflict could occur based on the constraint applied to a task. This can happen if a MustStartOn, MustFinishOn, StartNoLaterThan, or FinishNoLaterThan constraint is applied to the successor of a dependency in a project scheduled from the start date. If the project is scheduled from the finish date, this can happen if a MustStartOn, MustFinishOn, StartNoEarlierThan, or FinishNoEarlierThan constraint is applied to the predecessor of a dependency.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskInNonWorkingDayWarningAction
member.summary: Represents the various actions possible when a warning occurs because a task with working time duration is in non-working day.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskInNonWorkingDayWarningAction.MoveToWorkingDay
member.summary: Move the task to a valid working day. If the task start has been moved into a non-working day, it will be moved to the next possible working day. If the task finish has been moved into a non-working day, it will be moved to the previous possible working day.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskInNonWorkingDayWarningAction.AddExceptionToCalendar
member.summary: Add an exception to the collection of the current calendar associated with the task.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskInNonWorkingDayWarningAction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the change which caused the warning.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskProperty.Predecessors
member.summary: Identifies the property used to supply the value for the property. The underlying field in the data source contains a string that is comma separated id's of the tasks that are the predecessors. Each id can be optionally followed by link type and lag values in the format of ((FF|FS|SS|SF)((+|-)number(format)?)?)?, separated from the id by ':' character. Any special characters, like ',' or ':' are escaped using '\' character.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskProperty.Resources
member.summary: Identifies the property used to supply the value for the property. The underlying field in the data source contains a string that is comma separated id's of resources. Each id can be optionally followed by a units value within '[]' representing the portion of the resource's time used for the task. Example: "ResourceA[40%],ResourceB[10%],ResourceC". Note: Any special characters, like ,[] are escaped using '\' character.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ListBackedProject.TaskDataItemIdInitializing
member.summary: Invoked when a new data item is created for a new , before adding the data item to the data source. It's used for the purposes of controlling assignment of id's to the data items that are created by the ListBackedProject when new project tasks are added.
member.remarks: TaskDataItemIdInitializing event is raised when a new ProjectTask is to be commited to the data source. First an underlying data source item is created and then this event is raised to allow you to set a unique id to use for this data item. If this event is not hooked into or the event arg's is not set by the handler then the default logic is to create a new GUID string and use that as the id, assuming the id field is a string type. If it's not a string type then there's no built in logic to create unique id values. In such a case this event can also be utilized to assign unique id's to data items created by the ListBackedProject.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.TaskTreeManager.CommitPendingUpdates(Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTask)
member.summary: Some properties are updated asynchronously, such as Predecessors. The reason for it is that the predecessors collection may be in the process of being modified with multiple changes and therefore it would be inefficient to update the underlying data item at each change. Therefore certain properties, especially collection properties, are updated asynchronously. This method commits any such pending asynchronous updates.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.ActualValuesLostDefaultAction
member.summary: Returns or sets the default action to use when actual values will be lost on a task as a result of the task being deleted or having certain values changed.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.AlwaysHonorTaskConstraintDates
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the overrides the task relationships.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.AutoAddNewResources
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether a new should be added to the when entering an unrecognized name into the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.ChangeConstraintTypeDefaultAction
member.summary: Returns or sets the default action to use when a task's constraint will automatically be changed due to some other value on the task changing.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .
Note: If the Allow value is specified, which is not valid for this warning type, the ModifyConstraint value will be used instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.ConstraintConflictsWithSubtaskConstraintDefaultAction
member.summary: Returns or sets the default action to use when a summary task's constraint conflicts with the constraint of one of its child tasks in that applying both constraints to the child task will violate one of them.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .
This type of warning only happens when is True.
Note: If the DoNotModifyConstraint value is specified, which is not valid for this warning type, the ModifyConstraint value will be used instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.ConstraintOrDependencyCannotBeEnforcedDefaultAction
member.summary: Returns or sets the default action to use when the task's constraint can dependencies cannot both be enforced because their rules are incompatible.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.CriticalSlackLimit
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the number of days of slack that a task must have in order to be considered critical when calculating the critical path.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.DateStringFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime string format used to indicate how dates are displayed within the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.DaysPerMonth
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the number of days used when calculating a day unit - e.g when a has a of Months.

remarks.p: Note: Changing this value does not change the durations on the tasks so this should be set before creating tasks. It will however affect the way that the duration is displayed.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .

member.summary: Returns or sets the default action to use when the user attempts to delete a summary task.

remarks.p: The default action can be overridden by handling the event and setting the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectSettings.DefaultStartTime

member.summary: Specifies the data source field mappings for the object.

remarks.para: ColumnPropertyMappings property is used to specify which fields in the provide data for which properties of the object.

You can set the property on the collection to true if the field names in the data source are the same as the property names as defined by the enum. You can also set UseDefaultMapping to true and add entries for specific fields to override the field mappings for those particular fields while having the rest of the fields use the default field mappings.

member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of time that has been completed so far.

member.summary: Returns or sets the date when the task has been completed.

member.summary: Returns or sets the date on which the task had started.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.CalculatedFinish
member.summary: Returns or sets the calculated date representing the finish date where the task should be displayed in the UI.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.CalculatedStart
member.summary: Returns or sets the calculated date representing the starting date where the task should be displayed in the UI.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.CompleteThrough
member.summary: Returns the date representing the point up to which actuals have been reported for a task.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.ConstraintDate
member.summary: Returns or sets the date used when enforcing the

remarks.p: Note: This property is not used when the is set to AsLateAsPossible or AsSoonAsPossible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.ConstraintType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of scheduling constraint to be placed on the task.

item.description: This is a flexible constraint that indicates that the task should start as soon as possible. This constraint does not utilize the ConstraintDate.
This is a flexible constraint that indicates that the task should start as late as possible. This constraint does not utilize the ConstraintDate.
This is an inflexible constraint that indicates that the task must start on the specified ConstraintDate.
This is an inflexible constraint that indicates that the task must end on the specified ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must start no earlier than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must start no later than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must end no earlier than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must end no later than the ConstraintDate.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.Deadline
member.summary: Returns or sets a target date indicating when the task should be completed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.DurationFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets the format for the duration for the task.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.EarlyFinish
member.summary: A calculated field that indicates the earliest date that a task could finish based on the predecessors and constraints.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.EarlyStart
member.summary: A calculated field that indicates the earliest date that a task could begin based on the predecessors and constraints.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.FinishSlack
member.summary: Returns the duration between the and dates.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.IProjectTask.FreeSlack
member.summary: Returns the amount of time that a task can be delayed without delaying any Successors or affecting the project's finish date.

member.summary: Returns the calculated identifier number that is assigned to each task.

member.summary: Returns or sets the date used when enforcing the

remarks.p: Note: This property is not used when the is set to AsLateAsPossible or AsSoonAsPossible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTask.ConstraintType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of scheduling constraint to be placed on the task.

item.description: This is a flexible constraint that indicates that the task should start as soon as possible. This constraint does not utilize the ConstraintDate.
This is a flexible constraint that indicates that the task should start as late as possible. This constraint does not utilize the ConstraintDate.
This is an inflexible constraint that indicates that the task must start on the specified ConstraintDate.
This is an inflexible constraint that indicates that the task must end on the specified ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must start no earlier than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must start no later than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must end no earlier than the ConstraintDate.
This is a semi-flexible constraint that indicates that the task must end no later than the ConstraintDate.

member.summary: A regular leaf task. This does not include milestones, summary tasks or a recurrence root task.

member.summary: A task whose property is set to true.

member.summary: A task that has child tasks including the Project Summary but does not include the recurrence root task.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskStates.Critical
member.summary: A task that is along the critical path. That is a task that cannot be delayed without affecting the project end date. A task is critical if it has no slack, has a Must Start On or Must Finish On constraint, has a As Late As Possible constraint in a project scheduled from a start date, has a As Soon As Possible constraint in a project scheduled from the finish date or has a finish date greater than or equal to its . Summaries are also considered critical. Items that would not be considered critical are the recurrence root, milestones, activities that were completed (i.e. PercentComplete = 100) or inactive tasks.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Schedules.ProjectTaskStates.Marked
member.summary: A task whose property is set to true.

member.summary: A task whose is 0.

member.summary: A task whose is greater than 0 and less than 100.
